fields.name: PLUGIN
fields.description: Currently running plugin pointer. Don't touch this.

fields.name: VERSION
fields.description: Version of Autorun-ng using semver format

fields.name: EVENTS
fields.description: Internal event registry. Don't modify this directly, use Autorun.on() instead.

functions.name: print
functions.description: Prints to the Autorun console in the format of [Lua]: ...

functions.name: read
functions.description: Reads a path relative to the active plugin's directory.

returns.description: Contents of the file, nil if failed to read

functions.name: write
functions.description: Writes to a path relative to the active plugin's /data/ directory. Cannot write outside /data/ for security reasons.

functions.name: append
functions.description: Appends content to a file at the given path relative to the active plugin's /data/ directory. Cannot write outside /data/ for security reasons.

functions.name: writeAsync
functions.description: ASYNCHRONOUSLY writes to a path relative to the active plugin's /data/ directory. Cannot write outside /data/ for security reasons. This is important to avoid blocking the main thread on large writes to avoid detection.

functions.name: include
functions.description: Reads and executes a Lua file from the given path. This doesn't do any caching.

functions.name: require
functions.description: Reads and executes a Lua file from the given path. This caches the output of the include so subsequent calls return the same values.

functions.name: mkdir
functions.description: Makes a directory recursively. This runs relative to the plugin's /data/ directory

returns.description: Whether the directory was created successfully, false if exists

functions.name: on
functions.description: Registers an event handler for the specified event. Returns an EventHandler object that can be used to remove the handler.

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.description: Name of the event to listen for (e.g., 'loadbuffer')

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Function to call when the event is triggered. Return value can modify event behavior.

returns.description: Handler object with remove() method to unregister the event

functions.name: trigger
functions.description: Triggers all registered handlers for the specified event. Used internally by Autorun.

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.description: Name of the event to trigger
Arguments to pass to event handlers

returns.description: First non-nil return value from event handlers, or nil

functions.name: detour
functions.description: Creates a detour (hook) on a target Lua function, redirecting calls to a replacement function. The detour is automatically enabled upon creation. The original function is passed as the first argument to the detour callback, followed by the original arguments.

parameters.name: detourCallback
parameters.description: The function to call instead of the target. Receives the original function as the first argument, followed by all arguments passed to the hooked function. Example: function(original, ...) return original(...) end

returns.description: Detour userdata object that can be used to manage the detour

functions.name: enableDetour
functions.description: Enables a previously disabled detour, causing calls to the target function to be redirected again.

functions.name: disableDetour
functions.description: Disables a detour, restoring the original function behavior. The detour can be re-enabled later with enableDetour().

functions.name: removeDetour
functions.description: Permanently removes a detour, disabling it and cleaning up all associated resources. The detour cannot be used after this.

functions.name: getOriginalFunction
functions.description: Retrieves the original function pointer from a detour. This is rarely needed since the original function is automatically passed as the first argument to the detour callback. Useful for code outside the detour callback that needs to call the original function.

parameters.name: detour
parameters.description: The detour userdata to get the original function from

returns.description: The original function that was detoured

functions.name: load
functions.description: Compiles a Lua string into a callable function without executing it. Similar to Lua's loadstring/load function. Use this to dynamically compile code at runtime. NOTE: The environment inside defaults to the global environment, NOT Autorun's environment.

returns.description: The compiled function, or nil if compilation failed

classes.name: EventHandler
classes.description: Object returned by Autorun.on() to manage event subscriptions

fields.name: event
fields.description: Name of the event this handler is registered for

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Removes this event handler from the event registry

classes.name: Detour
classes.description: Userdata object representing a function detour/hook. Contains internal state for managing the detour, trampoline functions, and the original function pointer. Created by Autorun.detour().

events.name: loadbuffer
events.description: Called when Lua code is about to be loaded and executed. Can be used to modify, block, or replace the code before execution.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name/identifier of the chunk being loaded

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The Lua code content to be executed

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Load mode ('t' for text, 'b' for binary, 'bt' for both)

returns.description: Return true to block execution, return a string to replace the code, or return nil to allow normal execution
